hero_title: Do you have the mentality of an Olympian?
hero_subtitle: Take our 60 second quiz and see if you have what's needed to win gold, regardless of your sporting ability.
question_1_question: 1. Are you slapdash or spot on?
question_1_feedback: Conscientiousness is a good predictor of success across many different areas of life, not just sport. It involves qualities such as attention to detail and thoroughness and changes little over a person's life time.
question_2_low: I'm tempted by the easy option
question_2_feedback: Being a perfectionist can be a very useful quality for a top athlete, but it is important not to set goals that are beyond your own abilities as this can lead to harsh self-criticism which can be counter-productive.
question_3_question: 3. Fly or flop when the going gets hot?
question_3_feedback: Mental toughness is what enables an athlete to cope with the pressure of competition and perform to the best of their abilities regardless of circumstance.
question_4_question: 4. Are you a rock star or a wallflower?
question_4_low: I'm a bit of a wallflower
question_4_feedback: Being a little narcissistic, or having a large ego, can be helpful for athletes, particularly in individual sporting disciplines. Having a desire to seek out the limelight so you can display your skills is one of the key elements here as is an ability to deal with criticism, although being too egocentric can have a downside.
question_5_question: 5. Take on the competition or check out of the rat race?
question_5_low: I only enter the rat race if I have to
question_5_feedback: In order to win you have to beat people â€“ this makes a competitive streak very important. But you must focus on rivals at the right time, for example while training. When it comes to the main event it is best to focus on just your own performance.
question_6_question: 6. Do you start the party or wait for the invite?
question_6_highest: I always get it started! Why wait?
question_6_low: I usually wait for the invite
question_6_lowest: I never get the party started
question_6_feedback: Top athletes are proactive, as success rarely comes to the person who waits for it. Proactivity is a stable characteristic, similar to conscientiousness, it tends not to change over a person's life time.
question_7_question: 7. Do you do things for the love of the game or material gain?
question_7_highest: For the love of the game
question_7_high: I'd say like, rather than love
question_7_low: Material gain is my main motivation
question_7_lowest: Material gain is my only motivation
question_7_feedback: Motivation is clearly very important for success. What matters is not what you do when people are watching you, it is about what you do when people aren't watching.
question_8_high: I'll do it, but only if it benefits me
question_8_low: I'm happy in my comfort zone
question_8_lowest: Do I have to do it?
question_8_feedback: Caring about improving your personal best is key for high performance in sport. Do you care where you come in comparison with others, or where how compare with yourself?
question_9_feedback: Self-confidence is one of the biggest of predictors of sporting ability. But it varies across different situations and can change dramatically over a lifetime. Your confidence in performing a specific task is probably more important here than your confidence overall.
question_10_feedback: The human brain can only focus on a limited amount of things at once - so you have to focus on what matters, and avoid things that can distract you from our own performance.
question_11_question: 11. Go it alone or look for help?
question_11_highest: I go it alone. I can cope by myself
question_11_high: I got it alone, most of the time
question_11_low: I look for help some of the time
question_11_lowest: I always look for help when i need it
question_11_feedback: You have to do it by yourself but you don't have to do it alone. Be aware of when you need help and then go out and get it.
question_12_question: 12. Target driven or hope for the best?
question_12_highest: Yes, targets are my only friend
question_12_feedback: It is important to set goals to help generate success. Choose practical goals that you can measure easily and that can be built on over time.
results_category_1_text: Congratulations! You have the mindset needed to compete right at the top level of competitive sport.
results_category_2_text: You have most of the strengths needed to be a good athlete, but you may struggle to make it on to the medals podium.
results_category_3_text: You don't have the mentality to compete in Olympic sport, but you would be a great asset to any local sports team.
results_category_4_text: It seems that you're don't have the mentality of an Olympian, but you could still enjoy sport at a recreational level.
results_category_5_text: It may come as no surprise that you don't seem to have the mental habits of an Olympian but you can still enjoy sport and exercise as a way of keeping active.
activity_1_text: Find more information on getting involved in sport at BBC Get Inspired
activity_2_text: Find more information on getting started with sport and exercise at BBC Make your Move
